cyclone.name: HERMINE
cyclone.current_location: about 60 mi (100 km) south of Key West, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: Moving west into the east-central Gulf of Mexico, then forecast to turn northwest and north, crossing Florida’s Big Bend and tracking northeastward along the Southeast U.S. coast before emerging over the western Atlantic

weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida Keys westward into the eastern Gulf, then Florida Big Bend through Georgia–South Carolina coast, eventually the Mid-Atlantic offshore waters
weather_observation.wind: No significant tropical-storm-force wind threat indicated for New York in the current 5-day outlook
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected in the next 5 days at New York Harbor
weather_observation.rainfall: Periods of rain possible late this week-end as the remnant system passes well offshore, but heavy totals (>4 in) not expected
weather_observation.other_hazards: Rip-current and hazardous seas possible along the New Jersey and Long Island beaches as the system moves offshore
